alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 29 at 6:21AM MDT until May 30 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Fire Weather Watch Issued for Late Monday Morning Through Monday Evening For Cheyenne County Colorado ... .Critical fire weather conditions are expected to develop late Monday morning across portions of eastern Colorado. Gusty southwesterly winds up to 35 mph and very low relative humidity values are currently forecasted. A cold front is expected to move through during the afternoon to early evening hours creating a sudden WIND SHIFT to the NORTHWEST. If a fire were to be ongoing the potential would exist for a rapid change of direction. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 254... * Affected Area...In Colorado...Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. * Winds...Southwest 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 11 percent. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
